hypothesis: Adding persistent outcome tracking + learning to maintenance.py closes GAP-1 (diagnostic-execution bridge) and enables self-improving check prioritization

before.gap1_status: OPEN — 37 checks, 0 automatic fixes, no resolution tracking

features_added: --learn flag — computes fire rates, resolution rates, chronic/actionable classification
CHRONIC detection — checks firing >80% with <20% resolution (anti-windup candidates)
ACTIONABLE detection — checks firing >30% with >50% resolution (productive checks)
SILENT detection — checks that never fire (vestigial candidates)
Trend analysis — total check items over last 3 sessions
after.gap1_status: PARTIAL — diagnostic→learning bridge built; diagnostic→auto-fix bridge still open

results.learn_mode_test: Confirmed working with synthetic 2-session data. CHRONIC/ACTIONABLE/SILENT classification operates correctly.

expect: maintenance_checks gains persistent state + outcome learning. GAP-1 partially closed. Learn mode identifies chronic vs actionable checks after 2+ sessions.
actual: CONFIRMED. 120 lines added. Outcome tracking saves per-check fire/severity data. --learn mode computes resolution rates and classifies checks as CHRONIC/ACTIONABLE/SILENT. First real recording: 14/35 checks fired. GAP-1 PARTIAL (learning bridge built, auto-fix bridge still open).
diff: Expected: persistent state + learning. Got: exactly that. GAP-1 only partially closed — the next step is wiring chronic-check insights into automatic suppression or escalation, not just reporting.
successor: Wire CHRONIC checks into orient.py recommended actions. Add auto-suppression for NOTICE-level chronic checks after 10+ consecutive fires without resolution.
